cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles SE of St. Croix
cyclone.trajectory: Moving WNW across the Virgin Islands toward Puerto Rico today, then expected to skirt the northern coast of Hispaniola tonight and Cuba Sunday–Monday before entering the Gulf of Mexico
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Puerto Rico (brush/landfall) and the northern coast of Hispaniola

weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico including Vieques & Culebra, U.S. and British Virgin Islands, northern & southern Dominican Republic coast, northern Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, Turks and Caicos
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeastern Caribbean from the northern Leeward Islands westward through the Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico and Hispaniola
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds around 45 mph with higher gusts likely through Saturday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected beyond elevated surf along exposed coasts
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 3–6 inches with isolated amounts up to 8 inches possible, leading to flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents; possible minor river flooding and mudslides in hilly terrain
